title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: Between life and death there is a library, and within that library, the shelves go on forever. Every book provides a chance to try another life you could have lived.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: An easy and proven way to build good habits and break bad ones. Transform your life through the power of small, consistent changes.

title: The Seven Husbands of Evelyn Hugo
author: Taylor Jenkins Reid
description: Reclusive Hollywood icon Evelyn Hugo finally tells her life story to an unknown journalist, revealing shocking secrets about her glamorous and scandalous life.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: Set on the desert planet Arrakis, this epic tale follows Paul Atreides as he becomes embroiled in a struggle for control of the universe's most valuable resource.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychotherapist becomes obsessed with treating a woman who refuses to speak after allegedly murdering her husband in this gripping psychological thriller.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A powerful memoir about a woman who, kept out of school, leaves her survivalist family and goes on to earn a PhD from Cambridge University.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit enjoying his quiet life, is swept into an epic quest to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom of Erebor from the fearsome dragon Smaug.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A coming-of-age story and murder mystery set in the marshlands of North Carolina, following the life of Kya, the 'Marsh Girl' who lived in isolation.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A mystical story about Santiago, a young shepherd who dreams of finding treasure in Egypt, and his journey of self-discovery and following one's dreams.

title: Project Hail Mary
author: Andy Weir
description: A lone astronaut must save humanity from extinction in this thrilling space adventure filled with science, humor, and heart-pounding suspense.

author: George Orwell
description: In a totalitarian future where Big Brother watches everyone, Winston Smith struggles with rebellion and love in this prophetic tale of surveillance and control.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A timeless story of racial injustice and childhood innocence told through the eyes of Scout Finch in 1930s Alabama.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: Set in the Jazz Age, this tale of love, wealth, and the American Dream follows the mysterious Jay Gatsby and his obsession with Daisy Buchanan.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Holden Caulfield's cynical yet vulnerable journey through New York City after being expelled from prep school remains a defining work of adolescent alienation.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: Elizabeth Bennet navigates love, marriage, and social expectations in Regency England in this witty and enduring romance.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: Frodo Baggins embarks on an epic quest to destroy the One Ring and save Middle-earth from the Dark Lord Sauron in this fantasy masterpiece.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: An orphaned boy discovers he's a wizard on his 11th birthday and enters the magical world of Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Handmaid's Tale
author: Margaret Atwood
description: In a totalitarian society where women have lost all rights, Offred navigates life as a reproductive servant in this chilling vision of the future.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: In a future society where happiness is manufactured and individuality is suppressed, one man questions the price of perfection.

title: The Hunger Games
author: Suzanne Collins
description: In a post-apocalyptic world, Katniss Everdeen volunteers for a deadly televised competition to save her sister's life.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: When Amy Dunne disappears on her wedding anniversary, her husband Nick becomes the prime suspect in this twisted tale of marriage and deception.

title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A journalist and a troubled hacker team up to solve a decades-old disappearance in this dark Swedish crime thriller.

title: The Fault in Our Stars
author: John Green
description: Two teenagers with cancer meet at a support group and fall in love in this heartbreaking and beautiful story about life and mortality.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: Set against the backdrop of Afghanistan's tumultuous history, this is a story of friendship, guilt, and redemption.

title: Life of Pi
author: Yann Martel
description: A young Indian boy survives 227 days stranded on a lifeboat in the Pacific Ocean with a Bengal tiger named Richard Parker.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: Death narrates the story of Liesel, a young girl living with foster parents in Nazi Germany who finds solace in stealing books.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: A symbologist becomes embroiled in a deadly quest to solve an ancient mystery that could shake the foundations of Christianity.

title: The Curious Incident of the Dog in the Night-Time
author: Mark Haddon
description: A 15-year-old with autism investigates the death of a neighbor's dog and uncovers family secrets in this unique and moving novel.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and son journey through a desolate post-apocalyptic landscape in this haunting tale of survival and love.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: The multi-generational saga of the Buendía family in the fictional town of Macondo, blending reality with fantasy.

title: Sapiens
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: A brief history of humankind, exploring how Homo sapiens came to dominate the world through cognitive, agricultural, and scientific revolutions.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut stranded on Mars must use his ingenuity and scientific knowledge to survive until rescue arrives.

title: A Game of Thrones
author: George R.R. Martin
description: In the Seven Kingdoms of Westeros, noble families vie for the Iron Throne in this epic tale of power, betrayal, and magic.

title: The Shining
author: Stephen King
description: A writer becomes the winter caretaker of an isolated hotel and descends into madness, terrorizing his wife and psychic son.

title: It
author: Stephen King
description: A group of children face their worst fears when they encounter a shape-shifting entity that feeds on terror in the town of Derry.

title: The Stand
author: Stephen King
description: After a deadly plague wipes out most of humanity, survivors must choose between good and evil in this epic post-apocalyptic tale.

title: Outlander
author: Diana Gabaldon
description: A WWII nurse is mysteriously transported back to 18th-century Scotland, where she must navigate love and survival.

title: The Time Traveler's Wife
author: Audrey Niffenegger
description: A love story between a man with a genetic disorder that causes him to time travel and his wife who must cope with his unpredictable absences.

title: The Help
author: Kathryn Stockett
description: Set in 1960s Mississippi, this story explores the lives of African American maids and their relationships with white employers.

title: Water for Elephants
author: Sara Gruen
description: An elderly man recalls his youth working for a traveling circus during the Great Depression.

title: The Lovely Bones
author: Alice Sebold
description: A young girl watches from heaven as her family copes with her murder and her killer evades justice.

title: Big Little Lies
author: Liane Moriarty
description: Three women's lives collide in unexpected ways, leading to a shocking death at a school trivia night.

title: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
description: An alcoholic divorcee becomes entangled in a missing person case after witnessing something shocking from her train window.

title: Me Before You
author: Jojo Moyes
description: A quirky young woman becomes a caregiver for a wealthy quadriplegic man, and their relationship transforms both their lives.

title: The Hate U Give
author: Angie Thomas
description: A teenage girl finds her voice and fights for justice after witnessing the fatal shooting of her childhood friend by police.

title: Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine
author: Gail Honeyman
description: A socially awkward woman's carefully ordered life changes when she develops feelings for a musician and befriends a coworker.

title: The Subtle Art of Not Giving a F*ck
author: Mark Manson
description: A counterintuitive approach to living a good life by focusing on what truly matters and letting go of what doesn't.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: The former First Lady shares her journey from childhood in Chicago to her years in the White House.

title: The 7 Habits of Highly Effective People
author: Stephen R. Covey
description: A principle-centered approach to solving personal and professional problems through character development.

title: The Power of Now
author: Eckhart Tolle
description: A guide to spiritual enlightenment through living in the present moment and transcending ego-driven thoughts.

title: Think and Grow Rich
author: Napoleon Hill
description: Based on interviews with successful people, this classic reveals the secrets to achieving wealth and success.

title: The Lean Startup
author: Eric Ries
description: A methodology for developing businesses and products through validated learning, scientific experimentation, and iterative design.

title: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: The authorized biography of Apple's co-founder, based on extensive interviews with Jobs and those who knew him.

title: The Immortal Life of Henrietta Lacks
author: Rebecca Skloot
description: The story of how cells taken from a poor black woman became vital tools in medical research and the ethical questions raised.

title: Born a Crime
author: Trevor Noah
description: The Daily Show host's memoir about growing up in South Africa during apartheid with his remarkable mother.

title: The Devil Wears Prada
author: Lauren Weisberger
description: A young woman lands a job as assistant to a demanding fashion magazine editor in this behind-the-scenes look at the fashion world.

title: The Notebook
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: An elderly man reads the story of his epic love affair to his wife, who suffers from Alzheimer's disease.

title: A Walk to Remember
author: Nicholas Sparks
description: A popular high school student falls in love with the quiet minister's daughter in this touching story of first love and loss.

title: The Five People You Meet in Heaven
author: Mitch Albom
description: An elderly amusement park maintenance man learns about the meaning of his life through encounters with five people in heaven.

title: Tuesdays with Morrie
author: Mitch Albom
description: A former student reconnects with his dying professor for weekly life lessons in this touching memoir about friendship and mortality.

title: The Secret
author: Rhonda Byrne
description: Based on the law of attraction, this book claims that positive thinking can create life-changing results in happiness, health, and wealth.

title: Wild
author: Cheryl Strayed
description: A woman hikes 1,100 miles of the Pacific Crest Trail alone to heal from personal tragedy and find herself.

title: Eat, Pray, Love
author: Elizabeth Gilbert
description: A woman's journey of self-discovery through Italy, India, and Indonesia following a difficult divorce.

title: The Giver
author: Lois Lowry
description: In a seemingly perfect society, a young boy discovers the dark truth about his community when he's chosen to receive memories of the past.

title: Divergent
author: Veronica Roth
description: In a dystopian Chicago, society is divided into five factions, and one girl discovers she doesn't fit into any single category.

title: The Maze Runner
author: James Dashner
description: A group of boys trapped in a maze must work together to escape while uncovering the truth about their imprisonment.

title: Twilight
author: Stephenie Meyer
description: A teenage girl falls in love with a vampire in this supernatural romance that launched a cultural phenomenon.

title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower
author: Stephen Chbosky
description: An introverted teenager navigates high school, friendship, and first love through letters to an anonymous friend.

title: Looking for Alaska
author: John Green
description: A teenager's life changes when he meets the enigmatic Alaska Young at boarding school in this story about love, loss, and growing up.

title: Paper Towns
author: John Green
description: A high school senior embarks on a cross-country road trip to find his mysterious neighbor who disappeared after leaving cryptic clues.

title: An Abundance of Katherines
author: John Green
description: A teenage prodigy who has been dumped by 19 girls named Katherine goes on a road trip to discover his purpose in life.

title: The Glass Castle
author: Jeannette Walls
description: A journalist's shocking memoir about her unconventional, poverty-stricken upbringing with deeply dysfunctional parents.

title: Into the Wild
author: Jon Krakauer
description: The true story of Christopher McCandless, who gave away his savings and hitchhiked to Alaska to live in the wilderness.

title: Into Thin Air
author: Jon Krakauer
description: A firsthand account of the 1996 Mount Everest disaster that claimed eight lives during a commercial expedition.

title: The Color Purple
author: Alice Walker
description: An African American woman's journey from abuse and oppression to self-discovery and empowerment in the early 20th century South.

title: Beloved
author: Toni Morrison
description: A former slave is haunted by the ghost of her dead daughter in this powerful story about slavery's lasting trauma.

title: The Joy Luck Club
author: Amy Tan
description: Four Chinese immigrant mothers and their American-born daughters navigate cultural differences and family relationships.

title: Memoirs of a Geisha
author: Arthur Golden
description: A young girl is sold to a geisha house and rises to become one of Japan's most celebrated geishas in pre-war Kyoto.

title: The Poisonwood Bible
author: Barbara Kingsolver
description: An American missionary family's experiences in the Belgian Congo told from the perspectives of the wife and four daughters.

title: Cold Mountain
author: Charles Frazier
description: A wounded Confederate soldier deserts and walks home to his beloved in the Blue Ridge Mountains during the Civil War.

title: The English Patient
author: Michael Ondaatje
description: Four people come together in an Italian villa at the end of World War II, each dealing with their own wartime trauma.

title: All the Light We Cannot See
author: Anthony Doerr
description: A blind French girl and a German boy's paths collide in occupied France during World War II.

title: The Nightingale
author: Kristin Hannah
description: Two sisters in France struggle to survive and resist the Nazi occupation during World War II.

title: The Pillars of the Earth
author: Ken Follett
description: The building of a cathedral in 12th-century England becomes the backdrop for love, politics, and social upheaval.

title: World Without End
author: Ken Follett
description: The sequel to Pillars of the Earth, set 200 years later as the Black Death ravages Europe.

title: The Other Boleyn Girl
author: Philippa Gregory
description: The story of Anne Boleyn's rise and fall told through the eyes of her sister Mary in Tudor England.

title: Wolf Hall
author: Hilary Mantel
description: Thomas Cromwell's rise to power in the court of Henry VIII during the king's quest to divorce Catherine of Aragon.

title: The Thorn Birds
author: Colleen McCullough
description: A sweeping saga of the Cleary family in the Australian Outback spanning three generations.

title: Roots
author: Alex Haley
description: The story of Kunta Kinte and his descendants, tracing African American history from slavery to freedom.

title: Shogun
author: James Clavell
description: An English sailor becomes a samurai in feudal Japan in this epic tale of culture clash and political intrigue.

title: The Count of Monte Cristo
author: Alexandre Dumas
description: A man wrongly imprisoned escapes and seeks elaborate revenge against those who betrayed him in this tale of justice and redemption.

title: Les Misérables
author: Victor Hugo
description: Jean Valjean's quest for redemption in 19th-century France becomes an epic story of love, sacrifice, and social justice.

title: Anna Karenina
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A married aristocrat's affair with a cavalry officer leads to tragedy in this exploration of love, society, and morality.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: Russian society during the Napoleonic era is depicted through the lives of several aristocratic families.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A poor student commits murder and grapples with guilt and redemption in this psychological masterpiece.

title: The Brothers Karamazov
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: Three brothers with vastly different personalities are drawn into their father's murder in this exploration of faith and doubt.

title: Jane Eyre
author: Charlotte Brontë
description: An orphaned governess falls in love with her brooding employer in this Gothic romance about independence and equality.

title: Wuthering Heights
author: Emily Brontë
description: The passionate and destructive love between Heathcliff and Catherine spans generations on the Yorkshire moors.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for revenge against the white whale that took his leg becomes an epic tale of man versus nature.

title: The Adventures of Huckleberry Finn
author: Mark Twain
description: A boy and an escaped slave travel down the Mississippi River in this coming-of-age story about friendship and moral growth.

title: The Picture of Dorian Gray
author: Oscar Wilde
description: A young man's portrait ages instead of his body as he pursues a life of hedonism and moral corruption.

title: Frankenstein
author: Mary Shelley
description: A scientist creates life from dead tissue, but his creature becomes a monster seeking revenge against its creator.

title: Dracula
author: Bram Stoker
description: Count Dracula travels from Transylvania to England to spread the undead curse, pursued by a group determined to stop him.
